results.title: Attenuation of hypertension, cardiomyocyte hypertrophy, and myocardial fibrosis by beta-adrenoceptor blockers in rats under long-term blockade of nitric oxide synthesis.
results.text_hl: The effects of @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ were investigated on @DISEASE_Pulmonary_Arterial_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000081029 @@@arterial hypertension@@@, @DISEASE_Hypertrophy @DISEASE_MESH:D006984 @@@cardiomyocyte hypertrophy@@@, and @<m>DISEASE_Cerebral_Ventricle_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002551 @@@ventricular ischaemic lesions@@@ induced by an 8-week treatment with the nitric oxide synthase inhibitor @CHEMICAL_NG_Nitroarginine_Methyl_Ester @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019331 @@@N(omega)-nitro-L-arginine methyl ester@@@ (@CHEMICAL_NG_Nitroarginine_Methyl_Ester @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019331 @@@L-NAME@@@; 20 mg/@SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ per day) in Wistar @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Pacca SR, de Azevedo AP, De Oliveira CF, De Luca IM, De Nucci G, Antunes E. Attenuation of hypertension, cardiomyocyte hypertrophy, and myocardial fibrosis by beta-adrenoceptor blockers in rats under long-term blockade of nitric oxide synthesis. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 2002 Feb;39(2):201-7. PMID: 11791005
